skillTree.localised_description: Long-dead destriers, awakened to serve their Unliving masters far beyond death.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit is Undead (does not rout, immune to terror, becomes unstable when Leadership is low).

skillTree.localised_description: The pride of Nehekharan armies, impacting enemy lines with bone-shattering force and grinding the corpses beneath their heavy wheels.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit is Undead (does not rout, immune to terror, becomes unstable when Leadership is low).

skillTree.localised_description: Giant leonine statues, almost impervious to harm; they wade through foes, crushing them like bothersome insects.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit is Undead (does not rout, immune to terror, becomes unstable when Leadership is low).

skillTree.localised_description: The pain of immortal misery, coupled with insane violence, characterises the return to Unlife for many of the Tomb Kings, who fight longer, harder and better than they ever could before.
You cannot build an empire without sacrificing a few sons…
The fluid used to embalm the Tomb King toughens his bindings, enabling him to withstand a greater degree of damage than would otherwise be possible.
Soaked in and toughened by embalming fluid, the cloth bindings used to mummify afford the wearer additional protection from all but a direct hit from mortal projectiles.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Experience gain: +35% for characters
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Experience gain: +50% for characters
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Symbolising immortality and eternity, the ruler of the Nehekharan Pantheon has always had a care for the wellbeing of his children.

Leadership: +4 for Tomb Guard and Chariot units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +8 for Tomb Guard and Chariot units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "They stand staring into the sun for eternity, the physical embodiment of the everlasting gods. Terrible ye who looked into their divine forms!"

effects.description:

skillTree.localised_name: Usirian the God of the Underworld
skillTree.localised_description: Those who oppose the faceless God of the Underworld shall suffer terribly, condemned to its lowest levels for eternity.

Missile strength: +20% for Casket of Souls units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_name: Asaph the Goddess of Magic & Vengeance
skillTree.localised_description: They who serve the Asp Goddess are blessed with a precise aim with which to reach their objectives.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve change: +20% when increasing

Missile strength: +20% for Skeleton Archers, and Sepulchral Stalkers units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: They who follow the Faceless one will descend upon their foes with the speed of the desert wind.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +4 when fighting in desert terrain
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +20% when in own or allied territory
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_name: Phakth the God of the Sky & Justice
skillTree.localised_description: It is said that the piercing eyes of Phakth can judge a man's soul in an instant, and know all the sins of his lifetime.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 when in foreign territory
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The sacred carrion who serve Ualatp can find much among the lost and abandoned in the desert.

effects.description:
Armour-piercing weapon damage: +10 for Carrion units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +10 for Carrion units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +10 for Dire Wolves and Fell Bats units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_name: Neru the Goddess of the Moon
skillTree.localised_description: Loved and pursued by Ptra, Neru watches over Nehekhara and prevents it from falling into darkness.

effects.description:
Ward save: 5% when in foreign territory
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: It is not possible to defeat such unshakeable spirit once its owner's mind is made up.
Kill many and you *are* a conqueror; godhood is then but a protracted slaughter away...
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
He whose will transcends death can strike out from beyond the grave, to devastating effect.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Death is not an impedance to the strongest of wills.
Beware the scorpion's sting, hidden 'neath the desert sands yet always poised to strike.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: In that dread desert, beneath the moon´s pale gaze, dead men walk. They haunt the shifting dunes of the breathless, windless night, brandish weapons of bronze in mocking challenge and bitter resentment of the life they no longer possess. And sometimes, in ghastly dry voices, like the rustling of sun-baked reeds, they whisper the one word they remember from life. The Name of the one who cursed them to their existence, more than death but less than life. They whisper the name, Nagash...
I will not be slain by the likes of you.
The sand will run red with the blood of Nehekhara's foes.
All of my stolen treasures will be recovered; from the ashes of civilizations if necessary.
The restoration must begin. Nehekhara shall rise from the sands.
Slay the interlopers!
The skeleton warriors are desiccated, but were a well-trained fighting force in their time. By exercising restraint in battle, their bodies can be preserved for further use.
The architects will be called forth to rebuild.

effects.description:
Construction cost: -10% for all buildings
	(local province)

skillTree.localised_description: Consult with the liche priests. Our armies must be maintained.
Qu'aph's magics upon them.
Call forth enchantments of Geheb.
Dynasties will rise and fall, but I will never relent.
With an iron will, this King commands his soldiers and servants to follow him without question or complaint.

effects.description:
Attrition: -50% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The promise of a glorious afterlife worthy of a courageous warrior keeps embattled troops focused on the grim task at hand.

effects.description:

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Carrying the blessing of the goddess Asaph, these arrows seek out the foe with unerring accuracy.

skillTree.localised_description: Death isn't necessarily the end; those who have pledged service must rise to fight again another day.

skillTree.localised_description: Dark litanies are uttered to restore the Tomb Kings' slain soldiers to a twisted, chattering imitation of life.

target_if: Unit is not Lord or Hero

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
Some of war's spoils are more difficult to see but are just as valuable as gold or jewels.
This one scours the battlefields, plains and dunes for the vanquished dead, so that his armies may march at full strength once more.
These jars contain the remains of many Liche Priests, which are useful for raising and binding a new force.
Nehekhara's mummified rulers are awake, their eyes burning with balefire, their thirst for power, conquest and vengeance every bit as strong as they were in life.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: By which the Undead armies of Nehekhara may remain deathless, undying and forever hungry for slaughter.

skillTree.localised_description: To the victor, the spoils. All of them. Always.
It stands watch over the land, lest the foe's insidious, opportunistic agents dare to strike.
Renowned among their allies and feared by enemies both mortal and otherwise, this Lord's every deed adds to their already legendary reputation.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Unlife is forever; it is therefore prudent to go willingly and prepared.
Time itself cannot harm those who have defied death.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Being fleet of foot is useful in a fight… or when trying to get away afterwards!

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The Vulture-God assists the desert poozler, lest they lose their way 'neath the scorching desert sun.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
This being has a plan - not just a game plan, but a master plan to achieve their long-term aims.
Careful planning, knowledge of the terrain and the weaknesses of the enemy are the key to victory.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.

nodes.localised_description: All vampiric creatures instinctively obey Arkhan's commands, for he is the agent of their creator.

nodes.localised_description: The vampiric warbeasts are more vicious and bloodthirsty than the carrion of Nehekhara.

nodes.localised_description: A necromancer of unparalleled skill, Arkhan binds the wraiths to his will and sets them loose in battle.
